alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Central Phoenix; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Pinal County; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 6:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 715 PM MST... At 625 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty outflow winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Falcon Field Airport to Chandler Fashion Center Mall to Bapchule. Movement was west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Glendale, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Laveen, East Mesa, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Tempe Marketplace, Piestewa Peak Park, Salt River Indian Community, South Phoenix and Arizona State Fairgrounds. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 135 and 181. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 208. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MST for south central and southeastern Arizona.
